title: Help with sucking at League
body:
So I've been playing League for a few months now and I've got my head around the game, but now that I'm Lvl 30, I'm being pitted against tougher opponents, I've been stupid enough to go into ranked unprepared and now my match history looks more red than it ever has before.

My skill level really rests between new players and skilled players (even low elo skilled players). I can't Top or ADC, I can Jungle, Mid and Support however. Any tips or slabs of paragraphs that help are appreciated, I don't need elo, I just don't wanna suck anymore.

Thx.

{{champion:28}}  <3

replies.body:
if you can support then I have more than a paragraph to help you with : 

http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/88ATNtFV-guide-how-to-get-out-of-bronzesilver-tier-season-6-version

apart from all that though, by looking at your profile : http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=Shuddervolt++  some specifics need to be fixed ASAP like :

- Never play support without a sightstone
- always upgrade your GP10 item at least to its second upgrade (ending a 38 minute game with a relic shield is a really bad build)
- buy boots for your jungler
- Do not go boots of mobility for support as a new player ... go for mercury threads and use that tenacity to your favor
- Farm >> kills

I recommend watching videos or streams of pro players; you'll subconsciously pick up on ways to improve your gameplay, and by watching someone else do it, the information sticks in your mind better. 

IMO, Tekk is a great YouTube channel for learning because it has videos on a variety of different champions and players, and it has a rating system to show how well the players perform each game.

/r/summonerschool is a good place for tips, try to see what you can improve on in your matches. How is your map awareness, your cs etc. 

If last hitting needs some work do a custom with just you and try your best to get as much cs as possible.
